title: Reduce surrender time when someone leaves
body: Playing a 4v5 or even a 3v5 just isn't fun. Lets reduce the time by ~5 mins per person who leaves. You can start a new game, and not feel like you wasted your time.

replies.body:
I have been saying this for a while:
If a player is not connected for a minute or is kicked from a game for inactivity, the minimum time to surrender should be lowered by five minutes.

lol

Only if they change it so if someone doesn't vote the ratio is read as if someone was dc.

successful surrender votes should be 3-0, 3-1, 4-1, 5-0

3-1 yes. 3-2 no. All the yes to no ratios remain the same just if you don't vote it only counts the actual votes. If you didn't want to surrender you should vote no instead of waiting out the timer. 

Surrendering needs to be difficult. Only if the vast majority votes yes should it pass. If 3 people are ready to surrender and one isn't then it should pass. It is unlikely that one player can do anything to convince 3 people to really try once they are ready to give up. If 3 people want to surrender but two don't there is still a chance those two can make a play to convince the other three to keep going.
But a majority vote would make it really easy to surrender. Like really easy. 5 people should require a super majority like it does.

Don't you think that this would just result inore 3-2 votes? I mean if it is a legit cc the vote of 3-1 counts and clears (unless I'm just that tired I'm imagining that), it is only when someone isn't gonna show up as red in the post game that the 3-1 fails. Usually that means someone didn't vote bc they didn't have to click no. All that change would do is make people vote instead of just letting it time out when they want to vote no but are fighting at the time.

A 2-1 vote fails in a 3v5. Why should 2 people be punished for a game that two people have disconnected in?

This is much better than the "leave without penalty if s.o. else leaves first" idea that people keep wanting to steal from DotA 2. It's a nice compromise between the players who just want to move on and the players who are tenacious (however many more there are of each on the team wins).

Surrendering is a dumb thing for people to do, i never surrender because there is always a chance that your team can make great plays and comeback. there have been numerous times when i have had this happen to me. A 4v5 or 3v5 can be fun because people have the skill to cooperate with each other to make the game worth it. don't be so quick to give up. i have won many 3v5's in normals. and have won 4v5's in ranked games as well. i have even had a match where we defend base with all inhibs down and respawning at multiple times for about 15 mins enough time for my team to get back into the game and were able to come back. MANY THINGS CAN HAPPEN IN A MATCH. Don't surrender and fight till the end. Give the enemy as much hell as you can.
